title: The Holocaust and its Representations
description: Overview of debates and controversies about artistic representation of the Holocaust. Focus on theoretical and philosophical texts at core of Holocaust Studies; examination of primary sources: poetry, theater, autobiography, film. Emphasis on questions of trauma, authenticity, memory, ethics of remembering. 4 lectures.
prerequisites: Completion of GE Area C4 or D5, or HIST 303 (may be taken concurrently) or graduate standing
